alert.note: Alert for Prairie; Wibaux (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:30AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wibaux and southeastern Prairie Counties through 330 AM MDT... At 229 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles northwest of Baker, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carlyle, Mildred and Saint Phillip. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM MDT for northeastern Montana.
